correctness.rationale: Largely incorrect and speculative with schema issues. Key problems: (1) Precursors: Article uses a bimetallic In–Ga precursor plus DEZn and O3, with TEIn added to adjust In content; TMGa is not used. Extracted 'Trimethylgallium (TMGa)' is incorrect. (2) Process variants: Article reports multiple IGZO ALD processes/compositions (A: TEIn:In-Ga:DEZn=1:2:2; B: 3:1:2; C: bilayer 3 nm B on 12 nm A). Only one process is extracted; supercycleDesign is wrong (just 'InGaZnO' count 1) and misses the required subcycle ratios and bilayer stack. Separate processes for A, B, and C are required. (3) Unsupported parameters: Reactor ('Cambridge Nanotech Savannah'), carrier/purging gas (N2), delivery method, pressure (0.1 mTorr), dosing/purge times, flow rates, saturation, nucleationPeriod are not reported in the paper and appear fabricated. (4) Schema violation: 'plasmaPower' set to null; if thermal ALD, the field should be omitted (type must be object if present). (5) Thickness: Film thickness is 20 nm for single-layer A/B and 15 nm (3+12 nm) for bilayer C; extraction fixes 20 nm without distinguishing processes. (6) Material properties: Band gap was measured by REELS with 3.28 eV (A) and 3.08 eV (B); extraction reports 3.2 eV by 'UV-Vis' (wrong method and value). Film composition is incorrect (atomicRatio '1:1:1' and a single 20% value), whereas Table 1 reports at.% (A: 20.1:28.5:51.3; B: 47.6:11.6:40.8) and In/Ga ratios (0.7; 4.1). Roughness given (1 nm AFM) is not from IGZO film; AFM data in the paper pertains to SiO2 surfaces (0.262/0.626 nm). Uniformity, conformality, density are not reported. (7) Device properties: Reported device metrics are wrong—paper gives VA: ION/IOFF 5.4e8, VTH 0.2 V, SS 194 mV/dec; VC: 4.8e9, -0.8 V, 180 mV/dec, current drivability 13.6 μA/μm—extraction uses arbitrary values (e.g., SS 0.1 mV, on/off 1e4, VTH 0 V). DeviceStructure is incorrect (should reflect vertical channel TFT and TGBC planar controls, not 'bottom-gate top-contact'). Corrections needed: replace Ga precursor with bimetallic In–Ga; add three separate processes (A, B, C) with correct subcycle ratios and bilayer thicknesses; remove unsupported reactor/pressure/flow/time data unless cited; omit plasmaPower field; update material composition and band gap from XPS/REELS; set device properties to Table 2 values; correct device structure description; avoid invented values and ensure all entries are traceable to the article.

completeness.rationale: The extraction is largely incomplete and not traceable to the article, with several schema issues. Key problems: (1) Multiple processes not represented: the paper reports at least two distinct IGZO ALD channel configurations used in devices (single-layer A, 20 nm; bilayer C, 3 nm B + 12 nm A, total 15 nm; single B used for controls). Only one generic IGZO process is extracted, so the supercycle-based bilayer process is missing. (2) Precursors incorrect/incomplete: the article uses a bimetallic In–Ga single precursor plus DEZn (Zn) and O3, with TEIn additionally to tune In content. The extraction wrongly lists TMGa for Ga and omits the In–Ga bimetallic precursor. (3) Supercycle design missing/incorrect: the reported ALD sub-cycle ratios (TEIn:In–Ga:DEZn = 1:2:2 for A and 3:1:2 for B) and the bilayer stacking (3 nm B on 12 nm A, vacuum not broken) are not captured; the provided subcycleSequence is meaningless (“InGaZnO”). (4) Film thickness wrong: extracted 20 nm, but the VTFT bilayer channel is 15 nm (3 nm + 12 nm) and the single-layer controls are 20 nm. (5) Reactor, pressure, dosing/purge times, flow rates, carrier/purge gases: none are reported in the paper, yet the extraction supplies specific values (e.g., reactor brand, 0.1 mTorr, dose/purge times, sccm flows) — these are hallucinated and not traceable. (6) Schema violation: plasmaPower is set to null (if present it must be an object; should be omitted for thermal ALD). (7) Material properties misaligned: band gap values are from REELS (A: 3.28 eV; B: 3.08 eV), not 3.2 eV by UV-Vis; refractive index, absorption coefficient, resistivity, roughness, density and uniformity/conformality metrics are not reported and should not be fabricated. Composition is wrong: article provides XPS at.% (A: In:Ga:Zn = 20.1:28.5:51.3; B: 47.6:11.6:40.8) and In/Ga ratios (0.7 and 4.1); extraction uses “1:1:1” and a generic 20%. (8) Device properties incorrect: reported values (Table 2) are VA: ION/IOFF 5.4×10^8, VTH 0.2 V, SS 194 mV/dec; VC: 4.8×10^9, VTH −0.8 V, SS 180 mV/dec. The extraction gives unrealistic/incorrect numbers (e.g., SS 0.1 mV, ION/IOFF 10^4) and the wrong device structure (“bottom-gate top-contact” instead of VTFT; TGBC is only for separate planar controls). To improve: add separate processes for A (single-layer) and C (bilayer) at minimum; correct precursors to include the In–Ga bimetallic precursor, TEIn, DEZn and O3; encode supercycle ratios (1:2:2 and 3:1:2) and bilayer stack (3 nm B + 12 nm A) in supercycleDesign; set correct film thicknesses; remove unreported reactor/pressure/timing/flow details or mark as unavailable (and avoid nulls that violate schema); align band-gap method/values (REELS), composition (XPS at.%), and device metrics (Table 2) with the article; set device structure to VTFT for vertical devices and TGBC for planar controls.
